overview:
Eric Brewer is a cloud computing pioneer who is currently a professor of Computer Science at UC Berkeley.

He developed cluster-based computing for Internet services in the mid 1990s, which led him to found Inktomi Corporation in 1996.

Brewer also created the US government portal, usa.gov, with President Clinton in 2000.

He developed the “CAP Theorem” that helps reason about what is possible in large-scale distributed systems and which is been one of the drivers for the “NoSQL” movement.
